page.title: 11LEDGARD BRIDGE BOATYARD
page.content: The boatyard is on the site of John Smeaton's original canal route which was later blocked off and the original lock chamber converted into a dry dock. It was the most important boatyard on the Calder & Hebble navigation during the period of 'Canal Mania'(1790's) when Mirfield had a prosperous boat-building industry, making wooden keels. There was a black smith's business to cater for the barge horses and implements are still on the site. It was last used comm- ercially between 1954 and '73 for the maintenance of wooden and steel boats carrying coal to Thornhill Power Station. The house in the boatyard was used by Wm.Jessop whilst constructing the C.& H.N. The present owner lives in the house, repairing old & modern craft and running a Water Bus Service between Mirfield and Brighouse.
